Hi there! I am a PhD Candidate in Statistics, working with  Erik Sudderth  (UCI) and  Michele Guindani  (UCLA). I combine Bayesian statistics and machine learning approaches to develop statistical models for structured data and scalable computational methods. I am a fellow of the  HPI Research Center in Machine Learning and Data Science at UCI .
I am very passionate about statistics and data science education. I work on a variety of teaching and research projects in this area, including on formative feedback to data science assignments, gamification, scientific writing and Bayesian thinking in STEM.
Outside of academia, I enjoy spending time in nature, playing board games and organizing road trips.

title: Research
text:
I work on methodological, educational and applied research in statistics and data science.  Learn more about my research interests and projects below.

Statistical methodologyStatistics educationApplied statistics


My methodological research lies at the intersection of Bayesian statistics and machine learning. I have worked on Bayesian nonparametric models and efficient posterior inference for network analysis and probabilistic clustering. I strive to illustrate the components of statistical models by creating visualizations: check out my papers, posters and presentations.
